newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: YTL Power debuts at 4.50 rgt.
newsitem.headline: YTL Power debuts at 4.50 rgt.

text.p: Shares of Malaysian power producer YTL Power International Bhd debuted on the Kuala Lumpur Stock Exchange on Friday at 4.50 ringgit agaist an offer price of 3.40 ringgit.

The company had offered 235.6 million shares for sale to the public. The offer comprised a retail issue of 60.6 million shares priced at 3.40 ringgit each, and an institutional portion of 175 million shares priced at 4.00 ringgit each.
Within five minutes of listing the share price fell to 3.90 ringgit, before recovering immediately to 4.0 ringgit.
Share debuts on the Kuala Lumpur Stock Exchange are usually listed at a substantial premium to their offer price.
YTL Power is the third company to list under the KLSE's infrastructure project companies (IPC) listing rules.
The company has said it plans to use the funds from the issue to repay borrowings and invest in interest bearing accounts for future power projects.
A unit of YTL Power, a power generation associate of YTL Corporation Bhd, owns and operates two power stations in southern Johor and east coast Terengganu states.
